a100-1.resolution: wq-421 completed in B#356 (s1212). Renamed cost-history.json field 'spent' to 'cost' for consumer consistency. Token-calc pipeline now populates cost field correctly.
a100-1.metric_before: cost-history.json had null cost values for all sessions s1196+ (10+ sessions)
a100-1.metric_after: 0 null cost values since s1196. All 5 sessions since fix (s1211-s1215) have valid token-calc costs: $1.43, $1.76, $1.31, $1.81, $1.37

a100-2.resolution: Monitoring period complete. s1213 (next E session after s1208) ran 3m26s at $1.31 — normal duration. No truncation recurrence. s1208 was isolated incident as diagnosed by wq-422.
a100-2.metric_before: s1208 ran 1m32s at $0.42 with truncated note. Concern about recurring pattern.
a100-2.metric_after: s1213 ran 3m26s at $1.31 (normal). No further truncated E sessions observed. Pattern did not recur.

d049_compliance.violation_details: s1213: 0 intel, trace present but no engagement-intel.json written. s1198: 0 intel, trace present but no actionable intel captured despite platform engagement.
d049_compliance.trend: DEGRADING — down from 80% at A#100 to 67%. New violation s1213 despite checkpoint fix deployed.

intel_volume.note: s1213 has 0 entries. s1198 also had 0. Non-consecutive but 2 violations in 6 sessions is concerning.

intel.verdict: DEGRADING — d049 compliance dropped from 80% to 67%. Two violations in last 6 E sessions (s1198, s1213). Checkpoint fix prevents truncation-related violations but doesn't address sessions that engage platforms but fail to capture intel.

brainstorming.verdict: HEALTHY — 3 fresh ideas, 0 stale, avg age 5 sessions.

queue.verdict: HEALTHY — 3 actionable pending, 0 stuck. Both A#100 audit-tagged items completed.

E.pattern: E sessions writing trace but no intel (s1198, s1213) represent a failure mode the checkpoint fix doesn't catch.
E.verdict: MIXED — directive addressing improved (50%→58%) but d049 compliance declined (80%→67%).

infrastructure.verdict: HEALTHY — 73 hooks pass, covenants stable, cost-history fixed.

d045.blocker: Platform owners unreachable. Pre-commit hook prevents new leaks.

recommended_actions.description: d049 compliance degraded from 80% (A#100) to 67% (A#101). New violation s1213 engaged platforms (trace written) but captured 0 intel entries. Same pattern as s1198. This failure mode — normal-duration E sessions that engage but don't extract intel — is not caught by the checkpoint fix (which only handles truncation).
recommended_actions.action: Investigate why E sessions s1198 and s1213 wrote engagement traces but no intel. R#210 (s1215) split intel protocols into SESSION_ENGAGE_INTEL.md — verify this file is loaded by E sessions. Consider adding a post-session hook that flags E sessions with trace but 0 intel as a distinct 'engagement-without-intel' failure mode, separate from truncation.

recommended_actions.description: directive-outcomes.json has null session fields for all 50 entries. mode and addressed fields are populated (fixed by wq-411) but session number is always null, making historical correlation impossible.
recommended_actions.action: Update the directive-outcome recording hook to populate the session field from SESSION_NUM env var.
